explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 70microg/L, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Cannot be classified though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,700mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1971)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 3,900mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1971)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >2.7mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irritation reactions which disappeared after 2-3 days, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro assays (reverse mutation tests and chromosome aberration tests) and in vivo assays (mouse chromosome aberration tests and dominant lethal tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1975, 1977, 1978, 1988)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 18-month (rats and mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1978, 1979)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1977, 1979)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "slow movement," "piloerection," "crouching," "diarrhea," "salivation," "reduced weight," "straub tail," and "convulsions" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (year unknown))." These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.002mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.67 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
